story:
Strive Theatre will tour The Rooftops of Paris to Edinburgh, where we will perform in Ryrie's Bar on Haymarket Terrace from the 2nd to the 15th of August as part of The Edinburgh Fringe Festival. There will be one performance of the show in The Hayloft, upstairs in The Long Valley in Cork City on Tuesday July 29th.

The Strive Theatre originally produced the play in January 2013, for a week-long run in the beer garden of Nancy Spain's Bar on Barrack Street in Cork City. It was written and directed by Strive co-founder, Ciarán MacArtain, and designed by co-artistic director, Hanan Sheedy. The production was a great success for us as a company and gave us a platform to co-produce Rory McConville's "The Frozen Field" (directed by Jack Holland) with Pots and Panic Theatre Co. in September 2013 in The Kino in Cork City. Our second full production came as Hanan Sheedy created and directed "Cassandra" which was produced in October 2013 at the Granary Theatre. The success and positive acclaim that "Cassandra" enjoyed has brought us to the next step for our young company; to tour "The Rooftops Of Paris" in Summer 2014.

We are doing this because we feel that the play carries a very necessary communication to contemporary audiences of this country and internationally. It concerns the struggle of a young couple who've recently bought an apartment in Cork City at the end of The Celtic Tiger. They journey into the recession expecting their first child and exploring their new home and community. Cara, while on mat. leave from a creche in the western suburbs, decorates their newly-built home in preparation for the baby. Charlie settles in to his new job in a bank on South Mall, and becomes close friends with his local publican, Tom Bradley. The men share a great love of words and through Tom, the dormant artist in Charlie is awakened. Charlie and Cara's journey gives us a perspective on the relationships of young people in this country at this time; Their relationship with each other, their society, their future and their own true selves. It is a critique of recent Irish society and an attempt to ground our time in the history and culture of our nation.

The money raised in this campaign will be used towards covering the cost of transportation, accommodation, stage design, printing and PR expenses. We greatly appreciate your contribution to the fulfillment of our process. Strive Theatre exists to offer an expressive outlet to artists in the community and to produce theatre in keeping with the ideals upon which the art was founded.

Go raibh maith agaibh agus go n-eirí an t-ádh libh go leir.

story:
“Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then said I, Here am I; send me.”

                                                                         -Isaiah 6:8

                                                                                                           

The Background

Over the past year, a lot of change has taken place in my life. As many of you know my family relocated to Savannah, GA in the summer of 2010, and I followed suit this past July. Leaving Athens was definitely not what I had wanted or even what I had planned for myself, however, God had something else in mind. He skillfully directed my path by closing and opening doors and providing me with opportunities that I never imagined I would have. I recently finished an internship at Savannah Christian Church with their Global Outreach department, and it was a wonderful and challenging experience. I was able to learn about how much time and effort is put in to ministry, and the joy and blessing that comes along with working towards something greater than myself. Throughout my internship, I was able to meet people from all across the globe, and it opened my eyes to how far-reaching the Gospel really is.

The Opportunity

 I have been presented with a chance to go and intern with an amazing family in Poland for June, July and August of this year. I would be serving with Proem Ministries located in ZakoÅ›ciele (I am still learning to pronounce it) which is not far from Warsaw. If you would like more information about the ministry and what they do, please take a look at their website www.proem.pl! Now I know Poland is a rather unusual place to go for an extended mission trip. Typically, one would go to a third world country where the physical and material poverty is prevalent. In Poland however, there is not as much physical poverty as there is spiritual. I was astounded when I learned that only 0.2% of the entire population is Evangelical Christian. Proem uses recreation, education, and inspiration to lead the people of Poland to a life-changing connection with Jesus Christ. You may be wondering what my role would be in all of this. I would be helping serve as a camp counselor, teaching a ballroom dance workshop, singing with the worship team, helping teach English using the Bible as a guide, and doing anything and everything that is necessary or needed at the time.

The Need

I am so thrilled about this opportunity, and I would like you to partner with me! First of all, I would like to ask you for prayer support. Pray that God would prepare my heart so that I may be effective in presenting the Gospel and showing love and compassion to everyone I encounter. Pray that God would be glorified through my words and actions. Pray that I would be confident and bold in proclaiming the truth in spite of my own fears and uncertainties. Pray also that the needed financial support would be provided. I need to raise an estimated $2,900 for the entire trip. The number is definitely intimidating to a college student, but if it is God’s desire for me to go, I am confident that He will provide the necessary resources.

I would be so grateful if you would prayerfully consider supporting me with your financial assistance. No amount is insignificant. 

Thank you so much for considering helping me achieve what I feel God has called me to do! 

Making a Contribution

Deadline: May 11th, 2012....It's not far away:D 

If you would like to make a contribution, there are several options for you! You may either donate online or you can send a check! The information needed for checks and cash donations is located below! 

The donations made online using this site are NOT tax deductable. If you choose to donate online I would ask that if at all possible you donate using PayPal. This would enable me to access the donated funds right away and use them to purchase the plane ticket!:) 

If you would like to send a check, simply make it out to Jaimie Freund and mail it to my home address located below!

125 Waterway Drive

Savannah, GA 31411

If you have any questions about getting a tax deductable receipt or anything else that might be on your mind please don't hesitate to ask!

 

Email: jameselisabeth91@gmail.com

Phone: 706.817.2804

story:
Onassis The Play

 

An exciting new play about Aristotle Onassis, his life, his rise to riches... the women in his life...Maria Callas,Jackie O and his demise... Is our life in our own hands or are we slaves to destiny?

 

  • Many lies have been told about Aristotle Onassis including accusations of being responsible for J.F.K. and R.F.K.'s assassinations; that he was a callous and insensitive hedonist.  This play puts the lies to rest and sets the story straight.

 

  • Go into the the life of Onassis, his relationships with Callas, Jackie Kennedy O., and his family. The rise of the self made man! But at what cost?

     

  • A refugee from Asia Minor becomes the Richest man in The World. He had the Midas Touch...Was The Black Widow (Jackie Kennedy Onassis) responsible for his downfall, the Kennedy curse? 

An evening with the man himself, Ari Onassis

"...Having millions does not always add up to what a man really needs in his life!"

 As you can see from our photos, the process is well under way to get Onassis onto the stage! You can ensure that we achieve this by donated as little or as much as you want!

Who we are:

The Ethos Experience Theatre Company

Help us on our maiden voyage to gather theatrical talent and bring their creativity to the stage for all to enjoy.

Hi. We are a group of theater, TV and film professionals that will bring quality original works from driven and undiscovered talent at an affordable price and make theater an integral part of the Los Angeles experience.

The Team:

Anthony Skordi:- Actor. After training at the Drama Centre London, Anthony joined the Royal Shakespeare Company going on to become a member of Vanessa Redgrave's, Moving Theatre Company. He has also worked internationally in theatre companies throughout Europe and South America. Anthony then showed his versatility by crossing over to the small screen where he was a series regular for six television shows including both drama & comedy. His more recent work includes guest star spots on MEN OF A CERTAIN AGE, DETROIT 187, and the upcoming video games of GOD OF WAR 4 and MASS EFFECT. Anthony has gotten a lot of notice for his lead work on the new Kevin Spacey feature film, ENVELOPE. This fall he will return to his roots and perform a one person play about Onassis, which will premiere at the Stella Adler Theater. http://www.imdb.me/anthonyskordi

Norman Kern:- Award winning sound designer http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0449486/

Alex Cohen:- Lighting designer http://www.behance.net/alexcohen-av, http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4756622/

Bruce Katzman:- Director/Actor/producer and teacher at the Stella Adler theater school http://www.imdb.me/brucekatzman

Heidi Leigh Hanson:- Costumes http://heidileigh.com

Jamie Mitchel:- Assc Prd. http://www.beachwoodcottagefilms.com/

Aristotle Dreher:- Production Photographer  http://www.aristotledreher.com/

And more creative people are getting involved daily.

Our Goal:

  • We want to give new and undiscovered writers, directors and actors a platform to showcase their work in collaboration with seasoned professionals.

This project:

  • A one person play about Aristotle Onassis, his rise to riches, his loves: Maria Callas and Jackie Kennedy Onassis and his demise.

Financing Request:

  • The amount we are asking for in this campaign represents only a portion of the overall amount needed.
  • We already have $7,000 with help from http://www.ecos.com/ Earth Friendly products, and other supporters!
  • We need YOUR help to raise the rest!

At least $8,500 more to cover the cost of lighting, sound, sets, stage manager costume, publicity, etc.  This is our first production and our future rests on its success. 

 

More on this project:

"Onassis The Golden Greek"

  • This is Anthony Skordi's first script writing project in collaboration with Willard Simms, an award winning playwright. The subject matter covers Aristotle Onassis, his rise to fame and riches, Maria Callas, Jackie Kennedy Onassis , how they met and the death of his son! By marrying into the Kennedy family, did he also inherit the Kennedy Curse?
  • Alex Cohen, a Brilliant lighting designer but nobody has seen his work outside of his City in Greece.
  • Bruce Katzman, a teacher at the Stella Adler theater school and actor. His first attempt at directing anything of this nature.

Why we need it:

  • You can help guarantee our continued success. If this goes as well as we know it will, we will be able to partially fund future projects with and for unknown talents!
  • We want to bring quality and high production value to our projects. We are looking for the cheapest and most cost effective way to do that by asking people to donate their time and talent but there is only so much we can ask.
  • We still need to rent lights, sound equipement, publicity costs, etc. Stella Adler theater are leaning over backwards to make this work and we thank them for it!
  •  Breakdown of $8,500 request
    • Sound, sound design: $1,000
    • Lighting, rental etc: $2,000
    • Set building/set: $2,000
    • Art Design/Props: $2,500
    • Producers: $1,000
    • Director/publicist/stage manager/box office/printing/playbill/postcards/posters/rehearsal space....some of this is already covered in part.

What your donation will help us achieve:

  • Your help will enable us to give performances in a wonderful space with performances especially for students, unemployed and seniors at a discounted price.
  • We are giving an opportunity to unknown/new talent (Writers/actors/lighting designers/sound, set buliders, etc.. to present and showcase their work at an intimate (99 seats) centrally located respected venue

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Do you think you cannot help? You can!!!!

  • Even if you donate the price of a coffee you will be helping
  • Donate your time to help with ushering, box office, etc.

Very Important Reminder:

The more sharing and comments, the better the exposure! So talk about us! Spread the campaign via your own Facebook pages and Twitter feeds! Email your friends. Comment on our posts here at Indiegogo where our exposure is based on traffic.

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Brent Thomas Whiteside and I want to be an actor (The End). Ever since childhood writing, acting, and just performing in general have been my escapes. I have performed in a number of plays and musicals. I also write, and have even produced my own works at schools and in other community venues. As any other artist would tell you, "its the only thing I can see myself doing in life." But for me, its much more deeper then that. I wake up every morning and its the first thing I think about. Everyday (all day), ideas of things to write about run through my head. Plots of plays, musicals, books, sketches or sometimes just characters. Who they are, what they look like, things they would say, how would they speak? All these thoughts run wild within me and wont leave me alone until I stop and write it all down. When I act I get a feeling that I've never felt from anything else. It's literally indescribable. Even just watching a performance is exhilarating for me! You enter a theater and just as the curtain rises you realize this could go anywhere, anything can happen right now. Either something life changing and magical or this could be the worst thing you've ever seen. And that alone thrills me! (I'm rambling now) 

Currently living in New York City, I am still chasing my dream. I was told by an old professor to look into a few acting schools/programs here in New York. I took his advice! I was recently into The Stella Adler Acting Studio's Summer Acting Conservatory. The Summer Conservatory is one of the most popular summer programs at the Stella Adler Studio. Students from all over the world come to experience this foundation-building course which approximates a full term of NYU Tisch School of the Arts program. It is officially approved by the National Association of Schools of Theatre as a summer training program. Classes include Acting Technique, Improvisation, Scene Study, Shakespeare, Movement, and Voice & Speech. Master Classes in Script Interpretation and Acting for Film & Television are given to supplement the training. The program begins with an orientation and ends with a presentation of contemporary and classical scene work. As stated on their website, The Stella Adler Acting Studio believes that growth as an artist is synonymous with growth as a human being. For more information on this school visit it's website at: http://www.stellaadler.com/

Im a firm believer in dreams and I truly believe anything is possible. Stepping out on faith has got me this far and with your help I will be able to go further!

Here's where you come in!

The program costs $3,500. I am interning for the Dramatists Guild of America and also working part time at Panera Bread. I have a little saved up, but not enough to afford the tuition and living expenses for the summer. 

I'm asking for $5,000 because that would completely cover tuition and help with living expenses. This is so important to me that I am willing to ask for help! 

Now if I do not reach my goal the money will still go towards me sharpening my skills. I have other potential programs and classes that I could take here in the city. I will use the money to take classes and attend workshops. 

My Promise to you!

I can promise you in return, that I will work my butt off and will keep you updated along the way. That means many posts: pictures, videos, and statuses! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have nothing to give, just keeping me in your thoughts and prayers will be enough!

Either something life changing and magical or this could be the worst thing you've ever seen. And that alone thrills me! (I'm rambling now) Currently living in New York City, I am still chasing my dream. I was told by an old professor to look into a few acting schools/programs here in New York. I took his advice! I was recently into The Stella Adler Acting Studio's Summer Acting Conservatory. The Summer Conservatory is one of the most popular summer programs at the Stella Adler Studio. Students from all over the world come to experience this foundation-building course which approximates a full term of NYU Tisch School of the Arts program. It is officially approved by the National Association of Schools of Theatre as a summer training program. Classes include Acting Technique, Improvisation, Scene Study, Shakespeare, Movement, and Voice & Speech. Master Classes in Script Interpretation and Acting for Film & Television are given to supplement the training. The program begins with an orientation and ends with a presentation of contemporary and classical scene work. As stated on their website, The Stella Adler Acting Studio believes that growth as an artist is synonymous with growth as a human being. For more information on this school visit it's website at: http://www.stellaadler.com/Im a firm believer in dreams and I truly believe anything is possible. Stepping out on faith has got me this far and with your help I will be able to go further!Here's where you come in!The program costs $3,500. I am interning for the Dramatists Guild of America and also working part time at Panera Bread. I have a little saved up, but not enough to afford the tuition and living expenses for the summer. I'm asking for $5,000 because that would completely cover tuition and help with living expenses. This is so important to me that I am willing to ask for help! Now if I do not reach my goal the money will still go towards me sharpening my skills. I have other potential programs and classes that I could take here in the city. I will use the money to take classes and attend workshops. My Promise to you!I can promise you in return, that I will work my butt off and will keep you updated along the way. That means many posts: pictures, videos, and statuses! Other Ways You Can HelpIf you have nothing to give, just keeping me in your thoughts and prayers will be enough!

story:
Exciting update: Transcendent's upcoming production of TITUS ANDRONICUS is now in process of pending Actor's Equity Basic Showcase status!

About Transcendent Ensemble Theatre Company (TETC)

Transcendent Ensemble Theatre Company is a new theatre company founded by Lindsay Bartlette Allen. This company is comprised of alumni from Theatre UAB (University of Alabama at Birmingham) and New York theatre artists. Lindsay's vision for starting this company was to build a community of artists in New York that worked with the same rehearsal/ development process that she learned from her education at UAB under her training in experimental/ devised theater and ensemble building. 

For Transcendent Ensemble Theatre Company's first production, Lindsay has developed her own adaptation of Shakespeare's TITUS ANDRONICUS. She describes it as, "...a 90-minute, highly-adapted, movement-driven take on Shakespeare's story that highlights the humanity behind the choices each character makes. In other words, this isn't a play about good vs. evil but a play about people who are faced with great tragedy and act out of revenge even when they know it might not be the "right" choice. We can all relate to this, right??" Lindsay will also be directing this project. For more information about her work and experience visit www.lindsaybartletteallen.com. 

Specific Funding Needs

We at Transcendent Ensemble Theatre Company are adopting "GO BIG OR GO HOME!" as our company mantra towards building this first production. Our goal is to raise $7,000 for six performance slots of this production at THE KRAINE THEATRE on East 4th Street! We can't do this without your help! Even small donations can add up very quickly and help us tremendously in raising our goal. If you are not able to make a financial contribution, we also greatly appreciate you helping spread the word about this amazing project!

Budget Breakdown:

$3,600: Rent cost at THE KRAINE THEATRE for six performances in September*

*This money also includes two technical rehearsals in the space!

$240: Renter insurance for the space

$175: Volunteer Accident Insurance for the actors

$25: 1 Fire guard certification (required by the space)

$800: Rehearsal space

$585: Set dressing, audio design, costume accessories, and props

$625: Publicity! This includes programs, posters, postcards/flyers, advertising, etc.

$950: Stipends for actors and Stage Manager

***If we don't make our goal, we will still produce this show! We might have to do even more fundraisers than we expected, but this show will go on! 

Thanks you in advance for your generosity and help with getting the word out about this exciting production!

For more info...

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/TranscendentEnsembleTheatreCo

Twitter: https://twitter.com/TranscendentETC

Email us at: transcendentensembletheatreco@gmail.com

story:
­­Hi. My name is Mariel Marshall. I believe in creating vibrant, creative communities; inspiring our youth through mentorship and training; sharing stories amongst young and old; and collaborating with a community to do it all. Oh yeah, and did I mention I make theatre.

I grew up in Kincardine Ontario: population 6,725. It’s a beautiful little town with a lot of charm. It’s also the place I was inspired to start a career in the arts. I am now a Toronto based theatre artist and have been working professionally for over seven years. Returning home is about giving back to the community that fostered my development and sharing my love of theatre with a rural, hometown audience. 

After convincing a couple of Toronto theatre folk to trek out of the big smoke to visit Kincardine, something strange and exciting happened. Like me, they fell in love with the community, the culture and people of the town. But after visiting a few historic sites throughout the community we realized that something vital was missing: the tradition of storytelling. With such a vibrant history and culture, we knew that we had to help. I told everyone I knew about the idea and together we formed a company of artists with a singular mission: to start a tradition of live, outdoor theatre in historic locals, to share stories amongst young and old, and to create a piece of theatre with the community, for the community. This is Sundown Theatre and we invite you to join our cause. Help inspire a culture of creativity as we bring to life a story of love, loss and transformation with our inaugural production: The Selkie of Kincardine.

Who is Sundown Theatre?

Sundown Theatre is a collective of theatre artists from Toronto, Kincardine, Nova Scotia and afar, dedicated to re-imagining and reinvigorating live, outdoor performance in the small Ontario community of Kincardine. Each member of the collective brings a unique skillset to the project as theatre artists and producers with a wide body of work in the professional theatre scene.

The Play:

We are thrilled to launch the company’s premiere production, The Selkie of Kincardine written by Claire Wynveen. This is an original play created for the performance site of Kincardine's lakeside bandstand: Dunsmoor Park. The piece will take place this August 12-25, 2013. Combining folk-mythology, a community youth choir and a bagpiper or two, this project will bring creativity, community-building and plenty of joy to the summer in a historic town. 

The Selkie of Kincardine is a tale told by a boisterous troupe of travelling players. The play will follow the story of a lonely fisherman who falls in love with a Selkie-lady named Ondine. A selkie is a mythological creature that can transform from a seal to human-form and is a common folk-tale in Scottish mythology. This piece is an opportunity to celebrate the community’s Scottish ancestry. With music and mythologies interwoven with local folklore, the piece will bring new awareness to our community's cultural backdrop.

Youth Mentorship

Sundown Theatre knows that in every art form beginners must start with models of those who have come before: the work we do today must create and inspire the artists and audiences of tomorrow. The Young Company is a professional training and mentorship program for aspiring artists between the ages of 13-19. It is the perfect vehicle to cultivate the community’s youth through training, mentorship and exposure to professional artists and theatre makers.  The training program will culminate in two weeks of performance on the company’s production, The Selkie of Kincardine.

Your Support

We are a company of artists with great ambitions and a shoestring budget. In order to make this project a success, we are calling on the Indiegogo community to help us raise $10,000. This money is critical in covering transportation, artist fees and production costs. We are a collective that operates on a not-for-profit structure, and all donations from this campaign are going directly to the project costs for The Selkie of Kincardine.  

We will be commemorating donations of $20 and above with an art-installation called “A Banner of a Thousand Names”.  This piece of banner-art will be painted by a local artist and will be displayed throughout the performance site in Dunmoor Park for the duration of the show. Show someone in your life you support the arts by donating in their name.

Making a Difference

  1. Help bring creativity, community-building and collaboration to a small-town community.
  2. Foster training and mentorship in our youth through professional development and performance opportunities
  3. Celebrate a community’s cultural heritage with a piece that explores the mythologies, folk-song and music of Scotland as well as local legends.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to share our campaign with your friends, family and professional networks. Indiegogo has some great share tools! Can’t contribute now, but love the idea. Well, check out our website www.sundowntheatre.ca and come and see the show in August. Tickets will be Pay-What-You-Can and all are welcome. Hope to see you at the beach.  

On behalf of the entire Sundown Theatre collective, thank you for your support!

story:
Hey Friend! 

Welcome! Thank you for giving us a few moments of your time. Please feel free to look around and learn a little bit more about our campaign! If you have any questions or specific concerns, please don't hesitate to drop us an email at InHeartTheatre@Gmail.com Talk to you soon! 
 

About Us

In Heart Theatre is a theatre collective that focuses on the deceptively simple aspects of the human condition. With a commitment to minimalistic storytelling, it is our goal to return to theatre in its simplest, and in turn most powerful, form. 

About the Play 

 In 2.5 Minute Ride, Lisa Kron invites her audience on a roller coaster ride through the Kron family album. Rising and falling between high hilarity and deep disquiet, Kron demonstrates with disarming simplicity that humor and horror can share the same human moment. The play switches back and forth between Kron's journey to Auschwitz with her father, a Holocaust survivor; her Michigan family's annual pilgrimage to a Sandusky, Ohio, amusement park; and her brother's marriage to his Internet bride. By moving seamlessly between these three diverse recountings, Kron creates a complex and at times startling meditation on how human beings make sense of tragedy, grief, and everyday life.

In Heart Theatre, in cooperation with the Rochester Art Center, is proud to present Lisa Kron's mesmerizing one woman tour-de-force, 2.5 Minute Ride. The play will prove to be an electric and evocative evening, providing a truly unique and moving theatrical experience for the greater Rochester area. But we can't do it alone! With your help, we can bring the best possible production to life! The piece will perform at the Rochester Art Center Friday, May 13th and Sunday, May 15th. 

About the Playwright  

Lisa Kron has been writing and performing theater since coming to New York from Michigan in 1984. Her work has been widely produced in New York, regionally, and internationally. In 2015 for her work on the musical Fun Home she won both the Tony Award for Best Original Score (Lisa Kron:Lyrics, Jeanine Tesori:Music) and the Tony Award for Best Book of a Musical. Fun Home was also awarded the Tony Award for Best Musical, making them the first all-female writing team to win all three prizes. Her other notable works include In The Wake, Well, and 101 Humiliating Stories. Lisa has received playwriting fellowships from the Lortel and Guggenheim Foundations, Sundance Theater Lab, the Lark Play Development Center, and the MacDowell Colony, the Cal Arts/Alpert Award, and a Helen Merrill Award. Lisa is a member of Actors Equity and serves on the Council of the Dramatists Guild of America. She currently resides in New York City with her wife Madaline. 

About the Director 

Philip Muehe is a Rochester native and freelance theatre artist. His other directing credits include Neil Bartlett's adaptation of A Christmas Carol (Empire Theatre Company), Looking for Fun (2015 Minnesota Fringe Festival), People Are Dancing and Hysterical  (Both part of Milwaukee Repertory Theatre's Rep Lab), and Tigers Be Still (Commonweal Theatre Company). Favorite assistant directing credits include Alan Bailey's The Memory of Water, KJ Sanchez's Harvey, Leda Hoffmann's The Amish Project, and Blake Robison's Peter and the Star Catcher. He is a proud alumnus of both Commonweal Theatre Company's Directing Apprenticeship and Milwaukee Repertory Theatre's Emerging Professional Residency. He holds a BFA in Musical Theatre from the University of North Dakota. 


A Little Love Goes A Long Way 

As we've previously said, this is something we can't do alone. Your contributions could make a world of difference! Here's what your generosity will help accomplish: 
  • $300 - Venue Rental 
  • $300 - Actor Stipend 
  • $150 - Performance Royalties 
  • $150 - Marketing (Posters/Programs)  
  • $100   - Misc. 

The Impact

It's an exciting time to be an artist in SE Minnesota. The arts are growing! Places like Rochester, Lanesboro, Winona, and many others are fostering wonderful art that rivals that seen anywhere else. The funds we raise from this campaign will go straight to the creation of more to add to that mix. Wherever you may be, wherever you may live or work, your generosity will have a direct impact on working artists and the blooming arts scene in SE Minnesota. This really is an incredible opportunity to not only help foster the art and artists in this part of the country, but to allow more patrons to participate in them. With your help, we truly believe we can accomplish that! 

Risks & Challenges

As with any artistic endeavor, we run a large financial risk. Our director has waived any stipend in support of using those funds for the show itself. Apart from raising funds to cover costs of the performances, providing our actor with a stipend is our primary goal. Her work will be greatly appreciated, and it's important to underscore how important her contributions and time really are. Regardless if In Heart Theatre is able to meet our goal, we will perform in May. The show must go on, but your support can help us put forth the best product possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to learn more about our production! While we know not everyone will be able to contribute financially, there are still several ways you can help us out. Here's what you can do:

  • Help us get the word out about our campaign, and generate some buzz for the production. Please share this page and our Facebook event! 
                 https://www.facebook.com/events/175206589531925/ 
  • Attend a performance of 2.5 Minute Ride, running May 13th and 15th at the Rochester Art Center 

Thank you again, and be well! :) 
          - In Heart Theatre

Her work will be greatly appreciated, and it's important to underscore how important her contributions and time really are. Regardless if In Heart Theatre is able to meet our goal, we will perform in May. The show must go on, but your support can help us put forth the best product possible. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Thank you for taking the time to learn more about our production! While we know not everyone will be able to contribute financially, there are still several ways you can help us out. Here's what you can do:
Help us get the word out about our campaign, and generate some buzz for the production. Please share this page and our Facebook event! 

                 https://www.facebook.com/events/175206589531925/ 
Attend a performance of 2.5 Minute Ride, running May 13th and 15th at the Rochester Art Center 

Thank you again, and be well! :) 
          - In Heart Theatre

story:
THE LAST DAYS OF CLEOPATRA

A pitch black working class comedy set in Dublin … Can a family that dance together... stay together?

"A rock n' roll portrait of modern Ireland that's so vivid it leaps to life from the first scene... Sexton rescues us from the calcified portraits of ourselves that we've been subjected to for years. Cleopatra is unruly…brilliant…it's a cause for amazement that a play this incendiary and implicating has been written at all. If you only see one Irish play this year, this is the one" - *****Irish Central.com                                                                                                                                           

THE LAST DAYS OF CLEOPATRA 

Harry has made some mistakes along the way, regrets he's had a few, he better not mention, A trumpeter in a quasi famous Showband in his salad days, he was pure ladies man who ran with the best of them, but gave it all up to drive a Taxi. Well a life in rock' n roll didn't exactly provide a nest egg for his two kids and his beautiful sick wife... he lived for the moment back then... But now he gets by on a meagre pension. and while his family is not exactly communicating, his wife is in hospital and he's somewhat estranged from his two kids, well they're hardly kids! Natalie, his self destructive daughter hasn't quite forgiven him for his infidelities and he's never had much of a relationship with his son,Jackie, well for starters he's gay! Sure look it, no one has spoken in years- but it looks like they might have to... at least so they can arrange the funeral.

Written by Laoisa Sexton                Directed by Alan King

The Last Days of Cleopatra, will be a co production with The New Theatre but the funding for the actual production needs to be raised by this crowd funding scheme, as it is not being raised by the theatre.

Getting a new play on its feet takes a lot of time, effort, putting the right team together and... money. We are very lucky to have the support of The New Theatre and we have raised a little capital through other means, however we really need your support to make this play  a reality.       The overheads for any production are huge and building the right group of talented professionals to support the production is of the utmost importance, but with your contributions the rewards can be great for everyone.

"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has"- Margaret Mead

This pitch black comedy deserves to be seen in Dublin, as its a very Dublinese modern play and this can only be achieved with your help through crowd funding.

What We Need to present Cleopatra in Ireland

  • FEE for  4 actors/ 2 wks rehearsals/ 2 wks performances
  • FEE for Director / 2 wks rehearsals/ 1 wk performance
  • FEE for Stage Manager/ 2 wks rehearsals/ 2 wks performances  
  • FEE for Sound Design
  • FEE for Lighting Design
  • FEE for Tech/ Load in for theater
  • FEE for Posters & Flyers
  • FEE for Rental of space for 2 wks rehearsals
  • 100 percent of funds raised will go toward this production.

"Where there's a will there's a play" -William Shakespeare

The intention of running this crowd funding scheme is to bring you a high quality production of this play, with the best casting and design production to support this story, just like we had in New York.

With Alan King on board as director and his notable experience as director with his own theatre company Purple Heart and his long history as an actor and his work with Dublin's Youth Theatre. Alan directed Laoisa in the NY production of Waiting for Ikea by and with Georgina Mc Kevitt. Georgina and Laoisa were both nominated for Best Actress in the 1st Irish Theatre Festival for the play. Laoisa won the Best Actress Award at the same festival in 2010 

Cleopatra in Ireland

  • Laoisa has proved her self in the US to be a formidable talent in both acting and playwriting, with 3 plays under her belt. For her work to be seen this side of the pond is important, as she hopes to continue to get her work produced and nurtured at home in Ireland.
  • Cleopatra was staged in Canada in late 2016 and in the Milwaukee Irish Festival where it won two Awards. So now with its debuts in North America its time to bring it on home to Dublin where it was conceived and where it needs to be seen!
  • THE FEMALE PLAYWRIGHT Female Irish playwrights are under represented in Ireland and rarely produced according to recent statistics.  It is nearly impossible to get your plays even read by funded theater companies in Ireland, let alone produced. Companies have their own relationships with their own writers that they work with again and again, and many are under commission, so it is very hard to break through as a new writer in such a small community. Increasingly it seems the only way is to get your play produced is to produce it yourself.
  • NEW WRITING is very important, and undervalued. Considered to be high risk by most established funded theaters, who produce only classics or commercial plays with guaranteed box office return and commercial appeal, instead of taking a risk with newer edgier pieces by new writers. Yet these new stories are important as they are recording how we live now, here at home in Ireland and who we are. This is a brand new play, it deals with themes of regret, redemption, forgiveness, loss and family conflict familiar to us all. Cleopatra is about love. 

Laoisa is an Irish actor and playwright. To date, she has had 3 plays produced in New York City on important Off-Broadway stages but she has not had any of her plays produced in Ireland.
In 2013, her debut  play, the compelling smash hit comedy, FOR LOVE opened at the legendary Irish Repertory Theatre, for a completely sold out run, the play received a coveted 5 ***** NY Times Critics Pick and went on to a mini tour of Ireland opening at The City of Culture Festival (2013) in Derry, then continuing on to Belfast, Waterford, two venues in Dublin and Galway. 

 The UK Times wrote-"The production comes with a purpose, certainly, but it doesn't sacrifice drama. Moreover, it represents a change of pace for the stage. It might reflect a form of femaleemancipation, but it is pro active in the liberation of theatre."

Recently Laoisa appeared in the title role in her brand new play, the critically acclaimed The Pigeon in The Taj Mahal. The play was produced by The Irish Repertory Theatre for a two month run and recently closed on New Year's Eve 2016. The play was named along with The Lyric/ Abbey co- production of Owen mc Cafferty's-Quietly as BEST OF THEATRE for 2016 by Irishcentral.com.

NY REVIEWS:THE LAST DAYS OF CLEOPATRA

 "A loud profane ultimately touching look at a down and out Irish family…as abrasive and self-deluded as they are, their pain and everyday struggles resonate filling the theater with emotions that come fast and thick…temporary relief comes in addictive behavior, promiscuity, alcohol and living in the past"- ****THEATER PIZZAZZ 

"Sexton depicts the city's working class but across genders and generations…Cleopatra is unstinting with it's often hilariously ribald Dublin idioms… the actors are splendid: vivid, vibrant, so is this play by a promising writer" - ***** NY TIMES Critics' Pick    

 "An evocative depiction of fraying family ties… Plenty of punch in it's sore bruised arms" -****TIMEOUT NY

 "Sexton has a gift for capturing the vernacular onstage in a way that sounds simultaneously sublime and authentic… stunningly beautiful"- ****THEATERMANIA 

"Sexton is a force to watch and be reckoned with…taking on the Irish working class and what little they have to make due with" -****TIMES SQUARE CHRONICLES  

 "A rollercoaster pace that doesn't let up and sweeps the audience along on it's emotional ride…Like some of the current TV offerings and films that show the less picturesque sides of the Emerald Isle, there is a grittiness and reality that hits home… Sexton is a truly promising new playwright and we look forward to the wackiness and sincerity of her future work"  -**** NYIRISHARTS.COM  

" It's classical Irish tragicomedy in the spirit of a modern Sean O' Casey, you laugh all the way through and are shattered at the end" -IRISHBLOG    

Other Ways You Can Help Cleopatra

Email it to your friends who might be able to make a contribution

Buy a Ticket to the show!

We have striven to offer great rewards to each of our donors from show memorabilia to free Opening Night Tickets. Please have a look at our rewards and see what difference you can make! Or please get in touch and let us know how you can help!

Thanking you!

 

The Last Days of Cleopatra is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a nonprofit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Last Days of Cleopatra will be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
story_txt:
THE LAST DAYS OF CLEOPATRA
A pitch black working class comedy set in Dublin … Can a family that dance together... stay together?
"A rock n' roll portrait of modern Ireland that's so vivid it leaps to life from the first scene... Sexton rescues us from the calcified portraits of ourselves that we've been subjected to for years. Cleopatra is unruly…brilliant…it's a cause for amazement that a play this incendiary and implicating has been written at all. If you only see one Irish play this year, this is the one" - *****Irish Central.com                                                                                                                                           
THE LAST DAYS OF CLEOPATRA 
Harry has made some mistakes along the way, regrets he's had a few, he better not mention, A trumpeter in a quasi famous Showband in his salad days, he was pure ladies man who ran with the best of them, but gave it all up to drive a Taxi. Well a life in rock' n roll didn't exactly provide a nest egg for his two kids and his beautiful sick wife... he lived for the moment back then... But now he gets by on a meagre pension. and while his family is not exactly communicating, his wife is in hospital and he's somewhat estranged from his two kids, well they're hardly kids! Natalie, his self destructive daughter hasn't quite forgiven him for his infidelities and he's never had much of a relationship with his son,Jackie, well for starters he's gay! Sure look it, no one has spoken in years- but it looks like they might have to... at least so they can arrange the funeral.
Written by Laoisa Sexton                Directed by Alan King
The Last Days of Cleopatra, will be a co production with The New Theatre but the funding for the actual production needs to be raised by this crowd funding scheme, as it is not being raised by the theatre.
Getting a new play on its feet takes a lot of time, effort, putting the right team together and... money. We are very lucky to have the support of The New Theatre and we have raised a little capital through other means, however we really need your support to make this play  a reality.       The overheads for any production are huge and building the right group of talented professionals to support the production is of the utmost importance, but with your contributions the rewards can be great for everyone.

"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has"- Margaret Mead
This pitch black comedy deserves to be seen in Dublin, as its a very Dublinese modern play and this can only be achieved with your help through crowd funding.
What We Need to present Cleopatra in Ireland


FEE for  4 actors/ 2 wks rehearsals/ 2 wks performances
FEE for Director / 2 wks rehearsals/ 1 wk performance
FEE for Stage Manager/ 2 wks rehearsals/ 2 wks performances  
FEE for Sound Design
FEE for Lighting Design
FEE for Tech/ Load in for theater
FEE for Posters & Flyers
FEE for Rental of space for 2 wks rehearsals
100 percent of funds raised will go toward this production.


"Where there's a will there's a play" -William Shakespeare
The intention of running this crowd funding scheme is to bring you a high quality production of this play, with the best casting and design production to support this story, just like we had in New York.
With Alan King on board as director and his notable experience as director with his own theatre company Purple Heart and his long history as an actor and his work with Dublin's Youth Theatre. Alan directed Laoisa in the NY production of Waiting for Ikea by and with Georgina Mc Kevitt. Georgina and Laoisa were both nominated for Best Actress in the 1st Irish Theatre Festival for the play. Laoisa won the Best Actress Award at the same festival in 2010

Laoisa has proved her self in the US to be a formidable talent in both acting and playwriting, with 3 plays under her belt. For her work to be seen this side of the pond is important, as she hopes to continue to get her work produced and nurtured at home in Ireland.

NEW WRITING is very important, and undervalued. Considered to be high risk by most established funded theaters, who produce only classics or commercial plays with guaranteed box office return and commercial appeal, instead of taking a risk with newer edgier pieces by new writers. Yet these new stories are important as they are recording how we live now, here at home in Ireland and who we are. This is a brand new play, it deals with themes of regret, redemption, forgiveness, loss and family conflict familiar to us all. Cleopatra is about love.

story:
PLUTO

We are Moonchild Theatre Company.

We're raising funds for our play PLUTO and as many know, Theatre is increasingly expensive to put on - even at OffWestend circuits. 

Our aim is to raise £1500 and only with your help, we'll be able to achieve this.

The funds will go straight into our Theatre Hire cost of the venue (yes, it really does cost that much) - simple.

But to make this more rewarding for you, friends of Moonchild, we've created some Perks along the way as our way of saying Thank You. 

Its easy to an essay about why we think you should help us raise the money, but we're just 2 Young Creatives  who believe in what we're doing, with a strong and true story to tell and would love to share that story with as many people as possible.

Thank you,

Liam & Callum.

story:
Growing Futures Kenya

We are building an independent community program in Rural Coastal Kenya. Working on sustainable agriculture and creative education.

We need $100 to pay someone to finish our terrace so we have a space to make videos. We need $10 for transaction fees. If we make more it will go for buying nice dirt to cover the rocks well so we can stop bruising our feet. We are already 90% finished building the terrace but 90 isn't 100. 


Currently we have a group of youth that have been practicing to make a dance video. Once we can finish our dancing terrace the youth will learn basic computer and video editing skills to make their movie. These skills are essential for development and the youth have no other place to learn these skills. 

What do you get out of it? We will dedicate the videos to our donors and post them on our blog http://growingfutureskenya.blogspot.com/ and our Facebook. 

Any extra money goes for continuing sustainable development and education in our beautiful little piece of Kenya.

We are also building a modest guest space for volunteers to stay and share their skills if you ever want a cheap to free place to stay in Kenya. 

If you like our project please share us!

story:
Who We Are

TE San Pedro Rep offers the Southern California community a unique alternative to the typical L.A. theater experience. A wholehearted celebration of empowered artistic innovation - from every background and medium, TESPR strives to reawaken the creative spirit in each of us. 

True to its name, TE San Pedro Rep is an artistic paradise - a caring, dedicated community fully invested in the work of every inspired craftsman. We joyfully embrace the interdisciplinary nature of performance, utilizing every aspect of human experience to delve further and further into the unknown. Through intelligent and fearless exploration, TESPR is committed to reexamining the fundamental works that have defined performance from Ancient Greece to Modern America. We knowingly stand on the shoulders of giants, casting our vision forward into a new era of American performance.

We remain committed to fueling the next generation of American art, creating visionary work that rattles the foundations of modern performance.

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous contribution will help "Raise The Curtain" on TE San Pedro Rep's REP CYCLE featuring The Underpants + The Vanek Trilogy - opening June 5th, 2015!

The Goal: $1,500 for the Rep Cycle's dynamic set, costume and lighting design. We are attempting our most ambitious, theatrical feat to-date - and can't do it without your support!

TESPR is giving all supporters of our production a Supporting Cast, Producer or Executive Producer credit - each with it's own perks and levels of recognition.

The Productions

The Underpants, adapted by Steve Martin from an early 20th century German play, takes broad, physical comedy to the extremes. TE’s production infuses our usual passion and performance zeal into the story of Louise, a 1960’s housewife who has the whole town in an uproar when her underpants fall off during the King’s parade. From her befuddled husband Theo, to a long line of hilarious suitors, The Underpants offers audiences an evening of giddiness and laughter sure to have you falling out of your “seat.”

The Vanek Trilogy, by Vaclav Havel, follows the character of Vanek (Havel’s literary alter ego) as he emerges from prison in late 1970’s Czechoslovakia.  Three scenes take Vanek from his job in a beer factory, to a dinner party with the bourgeois elite, and finally to the top of the political infrastructure itself.  Each stop reveals a searing (and often hilarious) window into the effect a society at the height of Cold War paranoia, has on its people – moving deeper into a world where everyone is watching and reporting on you all the time. Havel – the longtime critic of the Soviet state and eventually the first president of the Czech Republic – uses humor and his unique wit, to carry audiences on an unforgettable journey.

Other Ways You Can Help 

The success of this project lies in the sense of community it inspires. We believe in the power of community. It is an ever increasing force, a will that can do things that no single person - no matter their talents - can achieve on their own. Put simply, we are Believers. Optimists. Enthusiasts. We invite you to share in our dream - that together we can build an artistic paradise of devoted, passionate, and FEARLESS artists, boldly pushing the boundaries of performance throughout the world!

story:
The 1900s have been an interesting century for western societies -well, everywhere really. We survived two world wars, social revolutions, atomic family standards, and have seen the birth of the internet. This campaign however, is about a single social standard: How long should a man's hair be?

The better part of the 20th century insisted on short clean-cut looks. Of which I've written a little bit about on the blog which birthed this campaign. But since the days of "Get a haircut" being shouted in the streets it's become more acceptable for men to have long hair, right? I don't know so I am asking you, the internet, to vote for what you think it should be. And I'm putting my own head up for the experiment. That's not cousin It in the photo or a hairy Cthulhu, that's ME. So come'on internets, make your voice known.

Many of you reading this probably don't care, but y'know what? You don't have to care, vote anyways, it's FUN! Besides, aren't you at least curious how it'll all turn out?

So here are the rules:

  1. With the exception of the $1 level, each perk is a vote for my next hairstyle. I'm more than willing to try them all, but I only have one head, unless there's a second one nobody is telling me about, so I can only do one hairstyle.
  2. Each perk also has some swag included, be it postcards or switchblade combs, and I do solemnly swear to do my utmost to ensure that each contributor receives their swag regardless of which hairstyle I end up with at the end.
Here's an easy guide:


End of Campaign Scoring:

  1. First level scoring. Each perk is labeled with either a [C] to cut my hair or an [S] to save my hair. At the end of the campaign C and S will be tallied separately. The category that raises the most money is considered the winner.
  2. Second level scoring. From the winning category (either C or S) the perk that raises the most money, will be my new hairstyle.
  3. OF YOUR CHOICE scoring. There are several perks that allow the contributor free reign when voting. If the hairstyle picked is an "of your choice" variety, those choices will be tallied separately and published on my website. The choice with the most votes will be the option taken.  

MiniGoals

  • $100 - I will use a professional salon instead of trying to cut my hair myself using a broken hand mirror and a rusty pair of scissors.
  • $250 - Unlock $100+ donations (those things are expensive).

Stretch Goals

  •  $1000 - I will maintain the new hairstyle for an entire year (within reason)
  • $2000 - I will hire a photographer to create a "Themed" photo of my new haircut for poster swag.
  • $2500 - I will send out the themed photo on all the postcards.
  • $3000 - I will hire a film crew to record my hair being cut and post it privately on my website for contributors.
  • $3200 - I will buy pizza for the film crew.
  • $4500 - I will publicly post the video of my haircut to Youtube. 

Impossible Dreams

  • $20000 - I will give a portion of all profits to charity
  • $40000 - I will buy a rubber ducky and post pictures on my website.


And now for something totally unrelated, just to prove I'm a person...
Here is my evil laugh. I have practiced it for many years.



F.A.Q.

You need $500 for a haircut?
Not really, as far as I'm concerned $30 would work, and I will continue to proceed under the assumption that $30 is my campaign goal. But $500 is the minimum on Indiegogo and Kickstarter declined the honor of this little bit of fun.

If these are just votes why aren't they all the same price?
I spent a lot of time and effort growing my hair to this length. I like my hair, so the more hair the vote takes off, the higher it costs.

Why aren't the "save" votes as good as the "cut" votes?
Because the internet is full of short hairstyles for men, but what is there for long hair? Free and wavy, free and curly, ponytail, man-bun (I'd rather have a bikini wax), it's almost like our culture still expects men to keep their hair short.

What does "keep the haircut for a year within reason" mean?
Well, I'm not going to keep writing names on my head for an entire year (though I will keep it shaved), and anime hair is just impractical in the long term (all that gel) but otherwise I don't foresee any problems.

What is this OF YOUR CHOICE option?
It means, when selecting that perk, I assume there is a comment box (this is my first Indiegogo campaign) type your choice there. If that perk is the chosen hairstyle, I will tally those votes separately, publish the results on my website, and go with the option that has the highest number of votes. In the unlikely event of a tie, I will chose from the top options.

What if you have to write 20-gazillion names on your head? Are you going to write really small?
I will write names on a first-come/first-served basis until I run out of room. Once the first batch fades, I will continue with the next group and so on until I have written every name.

Why are you making this a crowdfunding campaign? Why not just make a petition?
Again, I spent a lot of time growing my hair out... Just a petition isn't enough to have me cut it.

Wait... isn't this a contest? And prohibited by Indiegogo?
Yes, it is a contest. However, I'm not offering any financial incentives or a "prize" that goes to a specific winner. Everyone gets to see the results, and contributors will receive the swag promised in their chosen perk, regardless of the outcome. Besides, I already asked them.

Why are you doing this?
Because it's fun.

Each perk also has some swag included, be it postcards or switchblade combs, and I do solemnly swear to do my utmost to ensure that each contributor receives their swag regardless of which hairstyle I end up with at the end.
Here's an easy guide:End of Campaign Scoring:
First level scoring. Each perk is labeled with either a [C] to cut my hair or an [S] to save my hair. At the end of the campaign C and S will be tallied separately. The category that raises the most money is considered the winner.
Second level scoring. From the winning category (either C or S) the perk that raises the most money, will be my new hairstyle.
OF YOUR CHOICE scoring. There are several perks that allow the contributor free reign when voting. If the hairstyle picked is an "of your choice" variety, those choices will be tallied separately and published on my website. The choice with the most votes will be the option taken.  
MiniGoals

$100 - I will use a professional salon instead of trying to cut my hair myself using a broken hand mirror and a rusty pair of scissors.

$250 - Unlock $100+ donations (those things are expensive).
Stretch Goals

 $1000 - I will maintain the new hairstyle for an entire year (within reason)

$2000 - I will hire a photographer to create a "Themed" photo of my new haircut for poster swag.
$2500 - I will send out the themed photo on all the postcards.
$3000 - I will hire a film crew to record my hair being cut and post it privately on my website for contributors.
$3200 - I will buy pizza for the film crew.
$4500 - I will publicly post the video of my haircut to Youtube. 
Impossible Dreams

$20000 - I will give a portion of all profits to charity


$40000 - I will buy a rubber ducky and post pictures on my website.

And now for something totally unrelated, just to prove I'm a person...Here is my evil laugh. I have practiced it for many years.F.A.Q.You need $500 for a haircut?Not really, as far as I'm concerned $30 would work, and I will continue to proceed under the assumption that $30 is my campaign goal. But $500 is the minimum on Indiegogo and Kickstarter declined the honor of this little bit of fun.If these are just votes why aren't they all the same price?I spent a lot of time and effort growing my hair to this length. I like my hair, so the more hair the vote takes off, the higher it costs.Why aren't the "save" votes as good as the "cut" votes?Because the internet is full of short hairstyles for men, but what is there for long hair? Free and wavy, free and curly, ponytail, man-bun (I'd rather have a bikini wax), it's almost like our culture still expects men to keep their hair short.What does "keep the haircut for a year within reason" mean?Well, I'm not going to keep writing names on my head for an entire year (though I will keep it shaved), and anime hair is just impractical in the long term (all that gel) but otherwise I don't foresee any problems.What is this OF YOUR CHOICE option?It means, when selecting that perk, I assume there is a comment box (this is my first Indiegogo campaign) type your choice there. If that perk is the chosen hairstyle, I will tally those votes separately, publish the results on my website, and go with the option that has the highest number of votes. In the unlikely event of a tie, I will chose from the top options.What if you have to write 20-gazillion names on your head? Are you going to write really small?I will write names on a first-come/first-served basis until I run out of room. Once the first batch fades, I will continue with the next group and so on until I have written every name.Why are you making this a crowdfunding campaign? Why not just make a petition?Again, I spent a lot of time growing my hair out... Just a petition isn't enough to have me cut it.Wait... isn't this a contest? And prohibited by Indiegogo?Yes, it is a contest. However, I'm not offering any financial incentives or a "prize" that goes to a specific winner. Everyone gets to see the results, and contributors will receive the swag promised in their chosen perk, regardless of the outcome. Besides, I already asked them.Why are you doing this?Because it's fun.

story:
April 23, 24, 25, 29, 30             May 1, 6, 7, 8

What's this show about?

The world of Mixed Martial Arts has experienced a recent upsurge in powerful female role models like Rhonda Rousey and Katie Holmes, and we would like to celebrate this cultural movement with a show about women in fighting.

Animal vs. Machine is a performance in 3 rounds, a wordless dance-fight hybrid show that focuses on two female MMA fighters as they duke it out for dominance in the ring.

In one corner we have the Animal, A veteran MMA fighter who has her Lover to support`and coach on the side. In the other corner we have the Machine, a novice tai chi martial artist whose accomplished martial arts father, brother and mother scrutinize her from the side. 

As the violence between these women escalates, each hit and blow they trade cracks open a new layer behind their drive to be in the ring, transforming this match from a rowdy celebration of violence to a poignant exploration of what fuels us to fight for what we want. 

Opening Night- April 23rd, Make sure to join us as PrismCo will be collaborating with House Party Theatre and The Striped Heart to throw a Las Vegas Fight Night party featuring live bands, games, and a special performance by House Party Theatre themselves! On top of all that we will be live- feeding the big UFC fight that night! Guests are invited to arrive “dressed to the nines” and join in on this awesome Vegas-themed after party! 


What You'll Get 

Instead of thinking of this as just a fundraising campaign, we'd like our funders to think of this as a VIP pre-ordering ticket system. While at the actual event, tickets will be $15 each, we will be giving all of our funders the opportunity to pre-order their tickets to this beautiful show for just $10 each. 

Additionally, we’re offering a ton of awesome perks that will only be offered for Animal VS Machine,  video of our behind the scenes process, VIP passes (complete with champagne for our high rolling ring side patrons) and pictures with our incredible fighters.


What we need: 

Your funds will be used for the following purposes:

Paying our highly specialized performers and designers for their work on this project

MMA style mats to protect our dancers and fighters

MMA style ropes and posts to create the ring

Risers for alternative audience seating

Professional-grade lighting equipment to create the cinematic shifts necessary in telling this story

Our marketing and outreach campaign, which includes paying for our design team and all of the posters, postcards, and t-shirts they will create


The Impact

There is so much be excited about with this production. From the complex and interesting female characters, to the fact that we have a real MMA fighter acting in our cast, to the general celebration of the power women are able to wield, this is certain to be a huge step forward in terms of cultural diversity both for PrismCo and the Dallas Theatrical scene in general.

Not only are we offering a type of theatre that is very rarely seen in the Dallas arts community, we hope our productions will offer opportunities to a wide variety of artists from different disciplines to showcase their work. For a lot of our visual, musical and performing artists, these shows can serve as their chance to premiere in the Dallas arts world, or hone their skills and try something completely new. We want to make sure these artists’ amazing talents are seen by Dallas artistic professionals and that they are fairly compensated for their incredible talents.

Also, because of the nature of PrismCo’s wordless, movement based theatre, our productions are an excellent medium for educational theatre, as we are able to present a variety of myths and other artistic experiences to a younger audience in a way that is engaging, and easily digestible for students of all ages.

Finally, we hope that PrismCo will ultimately help kick start West Dallas’ artistic growth as the area transitions into a new noncommercial arts district. With funding, we will not only be able to make our company stronger, but we will be helping to diversify the Dallas community of artists as a whole.

story:
Christine Bonansea is a multi disciplinary performer artist and teacher choreographer based in New York City.

Over the last 10 years, Christine Bonansea explored visual arts as well as physical performing techniques in collaboration with artist specialists from various fields (musician composer, visual artist, filmmaker). She’s been challenging the dynamics of live performance within the diversity of environment that she experienced in Europe, USA and Africa as an interpreter and choreographer.

FLOATERS#3 is the last part of a triptych. It’s a laboratory to explore the senses, to recreate an environment for questions and emotions. Christine sets up the audience in the center of the space, receptors, witnessing the subjective perception of the physical reality. She creates a kinetic environment with a ritualistic men trio to explore the thematic of identity and alienation of human being. They displace and manipulate the perceptions. The intricacy of the structure emphasizes the uncertainty of individual identities and their reality in the physical space.

She’s been collaborating with composer, visual artists and dancers internationally to create FLOATERS#3, exploring the potential and the impacts that the various stimuli generate in space and in the body. 


FLOATERS#3 NYC PREMIERE 
at DIXON PLACE 
Thursday, September 24 at 7:30pm 

A new cast will perform:

  • Choreographer, artistic director: Christine Bonansea
  • Dancers: Brandin Steffensen, Nicholas Bruder and Robert Kentucky 
  • Sound Composition and Performance: Voicehandler, Danishta Rivero and Jacob Felix Heule
  • Light and video design: Ian Winter and Olivia Ting.

This is a privilege to present this piece at DIXON PLACE in New York City, and  a great opportunity to invite the New York City dance community. FLOATERS#3 encountered a  frank success at the previous showings in Berlin and in San Francisco.

picture by Nailya Bikmurzina

The Indiegogo campaign is necessary to complete the cost of the production.  
The dramaturgy as well as the choreography of FLOATERS#3 need to be reset in the theater with a new cast from New York City and San Francisco.
We need you!

We need $5000 to cover all the cost of the performance. It includes space rental, artists fees, material rental and airfare:

1. Space Rental: we plan 10 days of rehearsals in studio and in the theater. This is an important amount of money but necessary to reset the space and rehearse the choreography with the performers.

2.  Artist fees: the project comprises 1 choreographer, 3 dancer performers, 2 sound composers and performers and 1 production and touring manager.

3. Material Rental: we need to rent an extra video projector for the tech and show time.

4. Airfare: we need to cover the cost of 2 flight tickets from San Francisco for the sound composers and 1 flight ticket for one dancer from Toronto. 

5. Communication cost: we need to print postcards and posters for additional advertisement of the show.

If we cannot reach our goal, I will prioritize the flight tickets expenses and the artist fees. 



Your contribution is crucial to us. We will be able to premiere FLOATERS#3 in NYC with your help on raising enough funds for the production. This is the first Indiegogo campaign I have created to help the company. 

The competition for contemporary dance in New York City is challenging. This showing is definitively an opportunity to grow my audience and be recognized by the local dance community.

I've been creating professional relationships in Berlin and San Francisco through years of work and presentations. The attention and confidence from international art organizations and theaters gave me enough support to take risks with the production of my pieces.

I believe that New York City is the next step to develop the company.

Our challenges

The amount of time dedicated will be condensed to recreate FLOATERS#3 at Dixon Place. Responding to economic issues, I often work in the emergency with the focus and experience of leveraging the theater space particularities.

I reach specific estheticism and concepts using visual, sound or movement for each of my pieces. My experience of adaptation to the difficulties helped me to sustain the company work and to tour it.

I can overcome the challenges and I believe that the presentation of FLOATERS#3 can be powerful at Dixon Place. 

BUT WE NEED YOU to make a dramatic difference. You will give us the possibility to reach the quality and the strength of the piece.

Other Ways You Can Help us

If you cannot contribute financially to the campaign, COME TO SEE THE PERFORMANCE!

Also you can get the word out about the campaign, sharing it with your friends, tweet it, post it, like it, follow it...There are always persons with you, around you who could be helpful and wants to be involved.

story:
I met Bulgarian actress and puppeteer Milena Milanova when she contacted me via Couchsurfing to ask if she could stay at my house while she was looking for an apartment in Madrid.  She was in the Spanish capital to study part of her masters in physical theatre at the RESAD (The Royal School of Dramatic Art).  At the time I was producing my first dance performance, and as a fellow arts and culture professional, I felt compelled to give her a place to stay.

Over those first few days under the same roof and the months she spent in Madrid, Milena and I developed a friendship that later blossomed into a professional relationship with the birth of “Nikotine,” Milena’s first solo puppet show in collaboration with the Sofia-based company Atelier 313.  It was through Milena that I learned about the age-old tradition of puppetry in Bulgaria and met her fellow puppeteers and mentors, including the brilliant director Veselka Kuncheva and actor/puppeteer Hristo Takov. 

I fell in love with the work of these highly professional artists and their typically Slavic bittersweet style of storytelling.  Once again I felt compelled to help, this time with touring the trio’s creations outside of their home and neighboring countries.  Our first steps were taken at the 2011 and 2012 Edinburgh Fringe Festivals.  On the heels of the Fringe, I suggested that "Nikotine" be paired with the puppetry piece "I, Sisyphus" to create a single explosion of Bulgarian puppet theatre, and “An Evening of Bulgarian Puppetry” was born

Over the course of 2012/2013, we’ve managed to develop a solid tour of the United States for October/November 2013 with performances in Chicago (Theatre Wit), Austin (Salvage Vanguard Theater), Houston (Talento Bilingue Theater) and New York (DROM) with the possibility of adding a couple of additional cities.  This would be the first time any of these artists have been stateside, let alone performed their pieces in North America.  But in order to make these Bulgarian puppeteers’ dream a reality, we need to raise the funds necessary to cover the high cost of international touring.

In an age when money for the arts is so scarce, we want to build our crowdfunding campaign on transparency, so here you have it.  This is what we need the money for:

  1. International travel (Bulgaria/US): $4,000
  2. Visas: $480
  3. National travel (Chicago-Austin-Houston+one more city): $2500
  4. Two weeks of groceries while on tour: $420

The amount that we raise will determine how long we can stay as well as how many cities we can perform in.  If we raise the whole $7400, we are set for 15 days in the US to perform in as many as six cities.

The brilliantly honed tradition of Bulgarian puppetry is not well known outside of Eastern Europe, but it’s high time it was!  Your support will not only help us introduce new audiences to this unique art form, but it will also help launch three exceptional actor/puppeteer/writer/directors on the other side of the Atlantic. 

Every little bit helps, so we hope we can count on adding you to our list of puppetry producers.   And even if you can’t support us financially, helping us spread the word about this crowdfunding campaign would also be greatly appreciated.  Thanks for taking the time to learn about our project!  We hope to meet you at one of our upcoming shows!

Our double-bill consists of the pieces “Nikotine” by Milena Milanova and “I, Sisyphus” by Veselka Kuncheva:

Nikotine Synopsis:

This adaptation of Anton Chekhov’s one act comedy presents a puppet version of Nikolay Nikotine, a man terrorized and traumatized by an overbearing wife. His conference on the ills of tobacco smoking, which his wife has forced him to give, quickly degenerates into a monologue about the trials and tribulations of being Nikolay Nikotine. Throughout his discourse Nikolay lies and tells the truth, loves and hates, sings and dances and speaks against one of his few remaining pleasures: smoking.

Praise for Nikotine:

“Throughout, this is puppetry of a very high order indeed, and Milanova’s considerable skills outshine those of many highly competent puppet companies.”
- Bill Dunlop, Edinburgh Guide

I, Sisyphus Synopsis:

“There is no fate that cannot be surmounted by scorn."

-          “The Myth of Sisyphus”, Albert Camus

In the performance “I, Sisyphus” we explore the journey of man’s eternal return to himself. Ever since Antiquity, philosophers have pondered the absurdity of human behavior.  Whichever road one may take, whoever else one tries to become, whatever escape-routes one might venture, he always continues to return to himself. Human life is a repetition of one and the same action. Spiraling, same, predictable. And this constant action makes us meditate not on the meaning, but on the meaninglessness of human life.

I, Sisyphus makes its world debut in Bulgaria in September 2013.

story:
Joignez-vous à huit danseurs exceptionnels et une équipe de concepteurs talentueux en soutenant la nouvelle création de Cas Public, Symphonie dramatique. 

SYMPHONIE DRAMATIQUE

Symphonie dramatique, nouvelle création d’Hélène Blackburn et Pierre Lecours, revisitera avec mordant le mythique couple de Roméo et Juliette. Cette adaptation, pensée pour tous les spectateurs, prendra prétexte de ce chef-d'œuvre romantique de William Shakespeare pour évoquer la séduction, le désir, le déchaînement des passions, la mort. Éloge de l’impossible et du combat qu’il faut livrer pour accomplir sa destinée, cette pièce puissante et sobre donnera un éclairage nouveau sur l'histoire d'amour la plus célèbre de tous les temps.

CAS PUBLIC

Fondée en 1989 par la chorégraphe Hélène Blackburn, Cas Public est une compagnie de danse contemporaine qui se distingue par une recherche novatrice ciblant différents publics. Chacune des créations qui ont ponctué l'évolution de Cas Public atteste la poursuite de l'excellence dans le renouvellement des codes gestuels. La réputation de la compagnie s’est construite grâce à la qualité exceptionnelle de ses œuvres reconnues pour leur fougue et leur prouesse et par une présence assidue sur la scène nationale et internationale.

Symphonie dramatique sera présenté en première au printemps 2014 au Québec et en France. Ce projet est un des plus ambitieux de la compagnie et votre appui fera toute la différence. 


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Do join our 8 exceptional dancers and a team of talented designers by supporting the new creation of Cas Public, Symphonie dramatique.

SYMPHONIE DRAMATIQUE

Symphonie dramatique, the new creation by Hélène Blackburn and Pierre Lecours, is a mordant look at the mythical couple of Romeo and Juliette. Their adaptation geared to audiences 9 and up draws from William Shakespeare’s romantic masterpiece to evoke notions of seduction, desire, unchained passion, and death. A paean to the impossible and the battle that must be waged to fulfil one’s destiny, this powerful and sobre work sheds new light on the most famous love story of all time. 

CAS PUBLIC

Founded in 1989 by choreographer Hélène Blackburn, Cas Public favours a research process in choreographic creation founded on the renewal of contemporary approaches to dance. Cas Public thus defines itself as a contemporary dance company dedicated to producing works for general audiences. Recognized for its high-energy, high-perfomance dance, Cas Public has staked its reputation on the exceptional quality of its works coupled with its presence on national and international stages.

Symphonie dramatique will premiere in spring 2014 in Quebec and France. This is one  of the most ambitious projects Cas Public has undertaken and your support will make all the difference.
